sentence.Network_en: When she walked onstage she was given a standing ovation.
sentence.Network_cn: 当她走上台时，观众起立鼓掌欢迎。

sentence.Network_en: We were standing onstage playing completely out of time.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们站在舞台上，演奏得完全不合节拍。

sentence.Network_en: Onstage, the musicians are actually sitting behind the loudspeakers.
sentence.Network_cn: 舞台演出时，乐师实际上坐在扬声器后面演奏。

entry.def: When someone such as an actor or musician goes onstage, they go onto the stage in a theatre to give a performance.

example.ex: When she walked onstage she was given a standing ovation...
example.tran: 当她走上台时，观众起立鼓掌欢迎。

example.ex: You have to be onstage at eight o'clock...

means.word_mean: 1. situated or taking place on the area of a stage visible to the audience

sentences.sentence: "it was time for her to go onstage"

auth_sentence.content: But neither the president-elect nor a surrogate appeared onstage.

auth_sentence.content: It is good that his time onstage was brief.

auth_sentence.content: I was intimidated to get onstage with Nora Ephron.
